instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> vcore has constantly 2.3v
threads.message:
CPU overheats and the OS can't boat, without the battery starts normally always, with battery it will boot into OS only if the laptop has cooled down, and crashes as soon as it warms up and has constant 2.3v on vcore.

Where to start?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> vcore has constantly 2.3v
threads.message: This could be a ME region problem, does anybody has messed whit bios chip???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> vcore has constantly 2.3v
threads.message: No this laptop has never been opened before this.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> vcore has constantly 2.3v
threads.message: Run ASD or if not available run internal diagnostics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> vcore has constantly 2.3v
threads.message: ASD passes, no problems found, i'm really clueless, without a battery connected this board works perfectly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> vcore has constantly 2.3v
threads.message: It boots without a battery because the CPU is clocked down without it. ASD EFI and OS both pass?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> vcore has constantly 2.3v
threads.message: We don't have ASD for this generation, the online hardware test passes, no problems found. It would be awesome to repair this board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> vcore has constantly 2.3v
threads.message:
[QUOTE="arash, post: 23136"]We don't have ASD for this generation, the online hardware test passes, no problems found. It would be awesome to repair this board.[/QUOTE]

What is it for this model ASD 3s162 I think?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> vcore has constantly 2.3v
threads.message: You were right, ASD finds no errors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> vcore has constantly 2.3v
threads.message: Could be <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7310</CHIP>/20/30 or something totally else. I have not seen this before so I have no idea.
